alert.note: Alert for Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 8:55PM EST until January 06 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Great Pee Dee River At Pee Dee affecting Florence and Marion Counties. Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County. For the Waccamaw River...including Freeland, Above Conway, Conway, Aiw At old Hwy 544 At Socastee, Longs...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Great Pee Dee River...including Bennettsville 10sw, Pee Dee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Waccamaw River at Conway. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water will begin to cause minor flooding of yards and a few roads in the Lees Landing, Pitch Landing, Savannah Bluff, and Riverfront South communities. Areas along Waccamaw CIR and Riverside DR may also begin to flood. Low areas along Gray Oaks Drive may begin to flood. Access to Hidden River RD may be cutoff. Overflow of vast uninhabited swamp and natural boat landings will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon and continue falling to 10.6 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon.
